page.title: 06POLLUTION
page.content: Plans to use this area as a dumping ground for nuclear waste raise violent protest from all sections of the community. The threat persists and a watch is kept for signs of activity. The Dyfi valley is used as a training ground for low flying aircraft which create a terrifying noise, interfere greatly with radio & TV reception & disrupt lessons at 2 schools which the younger children of Aberangell attend. Dumping of rubbish on the banks disfigures the rivers which are otherwise clear & clean. The ending of the yearly collection of large items can only make matters worse. Fish are steadily decreasing in numbers. It has been suggested that large scale forrestation may poison the rivers but it may be that forestry drainage methods cause too rapid a rise & fall in the water level.
